channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Excess litter, 8th August
item.description:
Theres excess litter and rubbish and plastic waste all along this road and in the vegetation at the road side and it needs a thorough clean.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicles, 7th August
item.description:
We have 10 abandoned vehicles from the same household they are parking their cars and leaving for a few years on the road - the vehicles are old and rusting and taking up space . I have a next door that is 85 and cannot park and another next door that has 4 children that cannot park and I feel unsafe parking as the cars may attract drug deals

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Verdun Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 7th August
item.description:
Large amount of clothes fly tipped onto private abandoned property (11 Englefield Path) and spilling onto public pavement. Abandoned gated part of the property and constant fly tipping needs to be addressed - it’s been a problem for years. Rats and foxes are causing issues to communal green and neighbours.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Tillingbourne Green, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7th August - the unit remains non-functional, TfL claims issue is resolved when clearly it hasn’t been resolved!, 7th August
item.description:
I would like to escalate a persistent issue with the countdown unit at the bus stop F - located at Great Portland Street (outside the Portland Hospital -209 Great Portland St). Despite previous reports and TfL’s claim that the issue has been resolved, the unit remains non-functional. I was at the stop earlier today (7th August) and can confirm it is still not working. This is not only inconvenient but undermines trust in the reliability of your service updates. I would appreciate it if a competent member of staff could physically inspect the unit rather than relying solely on remote diagnostics, which clearly do not reflect the on-site reality. Please confirm that this issue will be properly investigated and resolved, and let me know when I can expect the unit to be operational again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 205-207, Great Portland Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
